bibl.title: Despatch from Ezekiel E. Smith to William F. Wharton, July 2, 1889
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: Consulate General, U. S. A. Monrovia, Liberia, July 2nd, 1889
Mr. Ezekiel E. Smith To the Deartment of State.
Answers to interogations contained in Department Circular of May 10th 1889.
Consulate General, U. S. A. Monrovia, Liberia, July 2nd, 1889
Honorable William F. Wharton Assistant Secretary of State, Wasington, D. C.
Sir: I have the honor respectfully to send you the within enclosure in reply to your Circular, dated May 10th 1889, with reference to the Credit System in Liberia.
The questions were answered by the Attorney General, through the Secretary of State of Liberia.
I am, sir, your obedient servant
Ezekiel E. Smith, U.S. Consul General
1. Questions and answers, as to the Credit system in Liberia.
